How can I create a combined histogram plot from two different data frames in pandas? I am trying to plot the histograms of 'first' and 'others' data frames on the same plot, but each DataFrame is generating its own subplot. Here is my code:

```python
import nsfg
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
df = nsfg.ReadFemPreg()
preg = nsfg.ReadFemPreg()
live = preg[preg.outcome == 1]

first = live[live.birthord == 1]
others = live[live.birthord != 1]

first.hist(column = 'prglngth', bins = 40, color = 'teal', alpha = 0.5)
others.hist(column = 'prglngth', bins = 40, color = 'blue', alpha = 0.5)
plt.show()
```

When I use the code as is, it creates two separate windows with histograms. How can I combine these two histograms into one plot as shown in the example image?

To combine the histograms of two different data frames ('first' and 'others') into a single plot, you can plot them using the `plt.hist()` function and specify the `alpha` parameter to control the transparency, allowing both histograms to be visible on the same axes. Here's how you can modify your code:

```python
import nsfg
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Read the data
df = nsfg.ReadFemPreg()
preg = nsfg.ReadFemPreg()
live = preg[preg.outcome == 1]

# Separate the data into 'first' and 'others'
first = live[live.birthord == 1]
others = live[live.birthord != 1]

# Plot the histograms on the same plot
plt.hist(first['prglngth'], bins=40, color='teal', alpha=0.5, label='First')
plt.hist(others['prglngth'], bins=40, color='blue', alpha=0.5, label='Others')

# Add labels and legend
plt.xlabel('Pregnancy Length')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Histogram of Pregnancy Lengths')
plt.legend()

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```

In this updated code, both `first` and `others` histograms are plotted on the same set of axes. The `alpha` parameter is used to set the transparency of the bars, so that overlapping bars are visible. The `label` parameter is used to label the different groups for the legend.
